RESOLVED_ENTITIES.law enforcement officers: Andrew P. Graham and Jay Snodgrass

AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Brignoni-Ponce Jacquinot: Defendant and the truck's only passenger, argued against the suspicion of the truck's behavior, contested a two-level upward adjustment for possession of a weapon in connection with a drug trafficking offense, found with 286.44 pounds of marijuana and two unloaded handguns in the truck, and was sentenced to 46 months' imprisonment
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Jay Snodgrass: Border Patrol Agent with eleven years' experience, including a few months in the Alpine area, contributed to the reasonable suspicion determination, and authored a memo regarding the defendant's case
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Andrew P. Graham and Jay Snodgrass: Border Patrol Agents whose experience in the region contributed to the reasonable suspicion determination, testified about the driver's behavior and recent narcotics smuggling
